newsitem.title: USA: Isolyser, Microtek Medical to merge.
newsitem.headline: Isolyser, Microtek Medical to merge.

text.p: Isolyser Co Inc and Microtek Medical Inc shareholdes voted at separate meetings on Friday to merge the two companies, Isolyser said.
The company said the merger will make Microtek a wholly-owned subsidiary of Isolyser in what it described as a "pooling-of-interests" operation.
It said Microtek shareholders will receive 1.65 shares of Isolyser for each share of Microtek.

Isolyser said it will issue about 8.8 million shares on a fully diluted basis (including Microtek options) in the merger, resulting in about 42.3 million shares of Isolyser being outstanding (including all stock options) after the closing.
Microtek has about 5.3 million fully diluted shares outstanding, it said.

Isolyser also said it had refinanced about $21.9 million of Microtek's long-term debt by modifying its existing credit facility to include a five-year term loan of $15 million and a three-year revolving line of credit of up to $40 million.
"The products that Microtek manufactures and markets should create expanded markets for our OREX Degradables," it said.
Microtek, based in Columbus, Miss., makes surgical and medical supplies.

Isolyser, based in Norcross, Ga., makes a plastic called OREX Degradables that can be configured into an array of products like woven and non-woven fabrics and film. The plastic dissolves in hot water.
